metadata.title: How to Translate YouTube Videos 2025: Multi-Language Subtitles
metadata.description: Add translations to YouTube videos. Reach international audiences with subtitles.

hero.headline: How to Translate YouTube Videos
hero.subheadline: Reach global audiences. Add multi-language subtitles to your content.

sections.content: Translation unlocks your content for billions of non-English speakers. YouTube's global reach means your next viewer could be anywhere—if they can understand you. Adding translated subtitles and metadata expands your audience dramatically. Here's how to make your content accessible worldwide.

content.title: Auto-Translate
content.description: YouTube's AI. Free but needs editing.

sections.title: Translation Best Practices
content: Prioritize languages with largest potential audiences
Start with Spanish, Portuguese, Hindi for reach
Auto-translate is starting point, not final
Test with native speakers when possible
Consider dubbing for highest value content

faq.question: Does YouTube auto-translate subtitles?
faq.answer: Yes—'Auto-translate' option available on videos with captions. Quality varies, especially for idioms and technical terms. Good starting point but review recommended.

faq.question: Best languages to translate to?
faq.answer: Spanish has 500M+ speakers. Portuguese (Brazil) huge market. Hindi, Indonesian large viewer bases. Research where your content might resonate. Start with 2-3 key languages.

faq.question: Translated titles help SEO?
faq.answer: Yes—videos can appear in local language searches with translated titles and descriptions. Significant discovery boost. Often overlooked opportunity for growth.

faq.question: Should I dub videos?
faq.answer: For highest-value content, dubbing can significantly increase engagement. Expensive and time-consuming. Start with subtitles, dub best performers if justified by audience size.
